Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
microsim.simulation.component.SimulationComponent
microsim.simulation.Simulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationListener
public class Simulation extends SimulationComponent implements SimulationListener
Represents a simulation instance. Contains references to simulated components and timing constants. Pipes FrameEvent events from SimulationComponent components to external SimulationListener listeners.

  • Field Details

    • bus

      public Bus bus
      Simulated bus component. Instantiated first, all components connect to it.

    • proc

      public Processor proc
      Simulated processor component. Instantiated after bus, updated first in simulation cycles.

    • memory

      public MemorySpace memory
      Simulated memory component. Instantiated after bus, updated second in simulation cycles.

    • video

      public VideoDevice video
      Simulated video device component. Instantiated after bus, updated third in simulation cycles.

    • VIDEO_FREQ

      static final int VIDEO_FREQ
      Video refresh frequency in Hertz.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      static final int CPU_FREQ
      CPU clock frequency in Hertz.

      Frame update period in milliseconds.

      static final int CYCLES_PER_FRAME
      Number of CPU clock cycles per frame.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulation

      public Simulation(byte[] epromData)
      Instantiates simulation, loading EPROM data in memory. Sets self as listener to the simulation components involved.
      Parameters:
      epromData - data to load in memory

  • Method Details

    • onSimulationEvent

      public void onSimulationEvent(SimulationEvent e)
      Pipes FrameEvent events from SimulationComponent components to external SimulationListener listeners.
      Specified by:
      onSimulationEvent in interface SimulationListener
      Parameters:
      e - event to pipe

    • step

      public void step()
      Performs a simulation cycle. A cycle is performed by:
      1. Stepping the bus to propagate buffered values.
      2. Stepping components. Components are stepped in order:
        1. Processor.
        2. Memory space.
        3. I/O devices.
      Specified by:
      step in class SimulationComponent

    • run

      public void run()
      Executes simulation. All components on bus do CYCLES_PER_FRAME cycles per frame, and at the end of frames video updates, at VIDEO_FREQ Hz.
